Description: Portrait of Abbas II, the last Khedive of Egypt and Sudan, half-length to front, looking towards the viewer, wearing military uniform with epaulettes, sashes,and bearing the Ottoman Collar of Hanedan, the neck badge of the Order of Imtiaz, and the sash and breast star of the Order of Imtiaz; No.5 from a series. Stencil-printed lithograph
Curator's comments: We are grateful to Rusty Greaves (email November 2020) for identifying the sitter and pointing out this is a rare Weißenburg illustrated broadsheet (Weißenburg, Burckardts Nachfolger, c. 1895), probably executed after 1889, possibly in 1895. These were published under the fictitious address of Hassan Uwais (Auvès) in Cairo. It probably was published under Camille Burckardt's successors, who took over the Weißenburg factory in 1889.
